result.execSummary:
The defendant Jonathan L Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-Heroin(>3-10g) [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(d)2.
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample.
Pay all of the following by the end of sueprvision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:  all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision.
All court costs, surcharges be paid through collection by DOC at an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count two. **02-08-2017 Credit for 83 days.
*10-20-2017/Decision and Order granted, JOC amended to include a total of 164 days of sentence credit on counts one and two.

superMiscConds.notes:
No drugs.
No possession, consumption, selling, distribution of illegal drugs.

Follow all rules of supervision.
Follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
AODA assessment.  Cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.  Absolute/maintain sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: **02-08-17 - Order commuting ES to five years
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm; also advised that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence, but concurrent with count one.  
**02-08-2017 Credit for 83 days.
*10-20-2017 Credit for 164 days.
---Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after three (3) years of confinement.

records.addlTxt: Per order signed on 10-20-2017 JOC amended to include 164 days sentence credit on counts one and two.

-Granting Motion For Additional Sentence Credit; Received, filed and signed by the Court on October 20, 2017. Copy forwarded to the defendant. Forwarded to closing for processing.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
DOC sentence computation.
Per order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to Hon. Janet C. Protasiewicz, Br. 24, for review. mag

Defendant's pro se motion to modify judgment of conviction (i..e. motion for additional sentence credit).  (Return Address:  Jonathan Ward #610973, Fox Lake Correctional Institution, P.O. Box 200, Fox Lake, WI  53933).
Original Transcript (63 pages) PLEA & SENTENCING HEARING, commencing OCTOBER 31, 2016, received and filed.
As to the order signed on 02-08-17 JOC amended to reflect 83 days as to both counts and commuted ES to five years on count one.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Timothy M. Witkowiak, Br. 22, for review.  spc
Letter from DOC requesting a review of the defendant's sentence.
Defendant's Motions in Limine received and filed.
State's Jury instructions received and filed.
Witness list - plaintiff received and filed.
State's Motions in Limine received and filed.
Notice of Expert Testimony received and filed.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Jacqueline W.

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 10 YEARS with 317 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 2; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 6 YEARS.

As to Count 2:

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS with 317 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence, but CONCURRENT to Count 1; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 1 YEAR; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after 3 years of confinement.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail Posted in this matter 
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections at an amount or percentage the department determines is reasonable of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

After further reflection, parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing.  Pursuant to negotiations, the Second and Subsequent Enhancer in Count 1 is dismissed & Counts 3 & 4 are DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Counts 1 & 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.   Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
